label: Bill of Sale to Thomas S. Grimke for the purchase of a slave named August, December 14, 1829
description: A bill of sale to Thomas S. Grimke for the purchase of a slave named August from Francis Giraud, who is described as "sound sober and no runaway." The back of the form includes a signed statement by attorney John Ward regarding the bill of sale.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: A bill of sale to Thomas S. Grimke for the purchase of a slave named August from Francis Giraud, who is described as "sound sober and no runaway." The back of the form includes a signed statement by attorney John Ward regarding the bill of sale.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information and reuse requirements contact Special Collections at Addlestone Library, College of Charleston, Charleston, SC, 29424.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 600 dpi, 24-bit depth, color, Epson Expression 10000XL, Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
BILL OF SALE-Print and Sold by J. Hoff.
The State of South-Carolina

Know all men by these Presents, That I
Francis Giraud
for and inconsideration of the sum of Five hundred and twenty
five Dollars
to Me in hand paid, at and before the sealing and delivery of these
presents, by Thomas S. Grimke
[the receipt whereof I do hereby acknowledge] have bargained
and sold, and by these presents, do bargain, sell, and deliver to
the said Thomas S. Grimke a negro Man named
August which said negro I warrant to be sound
sobert and no runaway

To Have and to Hold the said Negro Man August
unto the said Thomas S. Grimke his heirs

executors, administrators, and assigns to his and their only proper
use and behoof, forever. And I the said
Francis Giraud
my executors and administrators, the said bargained premises unto the said
Thomas  S. Grimke his heirs

executors and administrators, and assigns, from and against all persons shall
and will warrant, and forever defend, by these presents.

IN WITNESS whereof, I have hereunto set my Hand and seal
Dated at Charleston- on the fourteenth day
of December- in the year of our Lord one thousand
eight hundred and Twenty nine and in the fifty fourth
year of the Independence of the United States of America.

Signed Sealed and delivered
in the presence of

James A. Ashly
P Fayolle, attorney
of F. Giraud A

[End page 1]

South Carolina
Charleston

[I as an Attorney?] made oath that he
was present and Saw P [Fayette?] Sign and
Seal this Bill of Sale for the uses and purposes
therein mentioned and that he witnessed
the Same-
Sworn to before me this
13 Jany [January] 1830
John Ward
N.D

Received Charleston December fourteenth of Thomas
S Grimke Esqr. Five hundred and twenty five Dollars, for
a Negro Man named August.

P Fayolle attorney
of F. Giraud  A

Secretary of State Office
Charlest Jany [January] 13. 1830

I do hereby certify
that this Bill of Sale is duly Recorded
in Bill of Sale Book K K K K K
page 109-

John Ward
Dept Secty [Department Secretary] of State

[Written vertically] Francis Giraud
Per Atty [Attorney] Fayolle
To
Thos. [Thomas] S. Grimke

Bill of Sale for Fellow August

Date 14 Decr [December] 1829
Price- 525 [dollars]

Jay 13

[End page 2]
